intro: Bonafousia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed bonafousia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, pinnately compound leaves that emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Its small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
